title: The ORDER BY Clause
learning_objectives: Understand the The ORDER BY Clause concept in SQL

definition.concept_explanation: The ORDER BY Clause is an important SQL concept for working with databases.

To insert (John, 55000, Reggae203), on the other hand, we have to insert (Reggae203, B, 55000) into Enrolled and also insert (55000, John, null, null, null) into Students. Observe how null values are used in fields of the inserted tuple whose value is not available. Fortunately, the view schema contains the primary key fields of both underlying base tables;

common_mistakes.title: Syntax error
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: Typo in SQL keyword. The correct keyword is FROM, not FORM.

common_mistakes.title: Missing semicolon
common_mistakes.error_message: Some databases require semicolons to end statements
common_mistakes.why_it_happens: While some SQL implementations are lenient, it's best practice to end statements with semicolons.
common_mistakes.key_takeaway: Always end SQL statements with a semicolon
